name: Thabo
dialog: The lighthouse keeper?
He didn’t leave town.
He just… stopped being seen.
postQuestDialog: Then he was still trying to do his job.
Even after everyone else moved on.

quest.description: Recover belongings left behind by the lighthouse keeper.

name: Lerato
dialog: I miss the smell of rain along the cliffs.
Storms come fast, then disappear into the bay.
The coast really shows its moods here.

name: Sipho
dialog: Nothing beats a braai by the seaside.
Everyone debates which boerewors brand is best.
As long as the fire is hot, the day’s a win.

name: Nomsa
dialog: The wind off the ocean is fierce.
One second calm, next your hat sails away.
Still, the view over the cliffs makes it worth it.

name: Kagiso
dialog: You’re asking about the bell?
It wasn’t for ships. It was for people.
When someone didn’t come home… it rang.

quest.description: Find remnants of the town’s old emergency paths.

name: Zanele
dialog: Local music by the waves lifts the spirit.
The rhythm makes your feet chase the shoreline.
You can’t help but move with it.

name: Musa
dialog: The beaches here are peaceful, with warm water and warmer smiles.
Just don’t forget sun protection.
The tide and the people are what make it magical.

name: Anele
dialog: Hiking the coastal cliffs clears the mind.
The cliffs make you feel small, yet part of something larger.
Adventure is all around here if you look.

name: Vusi
dialog: Even small power outages reveal our patience.
Cooking on gas becomes an art.
You have to laugh and enjoy the moment.

name: Busisiwe
dialog: Hearing different languages on the wind is beautiful.
They connect people, even strangers.
Our town has many voices waiting to be heard.

name: Sibusiso
dialog: The taxis are the heartbeat of our town.
Without them, the coast is silent.
Finding lost signs keeps life moving smoothly.
postQuestDialog: You recovered the missing route sign?
Drivers won’t argue at the harbor anymore.
You’ve kept the rhythm of the town alive.

quest.description: Locate the missing taxi route sign to help the early commuters navigate the coastal roads.

name: Palesa
dialog: Spring here paints the cliffs in gold and violet.
The wildflowers sway with the breeze.
It’s like walking through a living painting.

name: Andile
dialog: Soccer brings the town together.
Even the seagulls pause when the ball rolls by.
It’s chaos, laughter, and cheers in one field.

name: Kgotso
dialog: Evenings on the cliffs are calm.
Watching the sun set over the waves is enough for reflection.
Peace lives here if you stop and look.

name: Nandi
dialog: Some nights, when the fog rolls in, I hear a bell.
Not from the harbor — from somewhere deeper.
People say it’s just the sea, but it feels… intentional.
postQuestDialog: That sound… it wasn’t just in my head.
Maybe the town is trying to remember.

quest.description: Search the shoreline and forest edge for traces of the bell.

name: Themba
dialog: Driving along winding coastal roads teaches focus.
Every turn matters, every view is a reward.
City driving feels easy after this.

name: Ayanda
dialog: Elder stories whisper lessons without lectures.
Along the cliffs, the wind carries them far.
You remember them long after you hear them.

name: Mandla
dialog: Strength is more than muscle.
Enduring challenges along the coast builds resilience.
Our town teaches it quietly to everyone.

name: Noluthando
dialog: Kindness travels further than the tides.
A smile or greeting brightens the busiest street.
Ubuntu is alive here, if you care to see it.

name: Hlokomela
dialog: No one walks up there anymore.
Paths don’t vanish on their own.
They disappear when people stop caring.

quest.description: Restore the forgotten markers leading to the lighthouse.

name: Thandi
dialog: Early mornings along the coast are quiet.
The town wakes with the sunrise and the waves.
Notice the little details others miss.

name: Refilwe
dialog: The park along the cliffs is forgotten lately.
Litter dulls its beauty.
Even small actions can bring life back.
postQuestDialog: The park already feels lighter and alive.

quest.description: Collect 5 pieces of litter scattered along the park pathways and cliff edge.

name: Bongani
dialog: Broken street lights make the town feel shadowed.
This one hasn’t worked for weeks.
Someone needs to restore it for night safety.
postQuestDialog: Even one light changes how safe the streets feel.

quest.description: Inspect and restore the broken street light along the coastal promenade.

name: Keabetswe
dialog: Children chase seagulls and balls near the promenade.
Balls often roll into the tide or the street.
Someone needs to gather them before they’re lost.

quest.description: Find 3 lost play balls near the town promenade and pier.

name: Samkelo
dialog: Vendors along the coast rely on foot traffic.
Signs guide visitors, but mine blew away last night.
Without it, customers get lost.
postQuestDialog: People can find your stall again.
The morning feels busy and happy once more.

quest.description: Recover the missing vendor sign along the coastal market street.

name: Mpho
dialog: The community board shares news for the town.
Lately, few check it.
Missing notices mean missed opportunities.
postQuestDialog: You put the notices back up?
It’s amazing how much that matters.

quest.description: Post 3 missing community notices along the promenade and market square.
Restore the old warning bell at the lighthouse.
